abstract: A federal judge on Thursday dismissed a lawsuit against Hewlett-Packard by a former executive who claimed the computer maker obtained his phone records illegally. H.P. has accused Karl Lamb of stealing trade secrets to start up his own flat-panel display company. Mr. Lamb’s lawsuit briefly re-raised the specter of pretexting, or the obtaining of personal information under false pretenses. Former H.P. executives, including ex-chairwoman Patricia C. Dunn, still faces charges that they authorized private investigators to pretext board members and reporters in the course of a leak investigation.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Thursday dismissed a lawsuit against Hewlett-Packard by a former executive who claimed the computer maker obtained his phone records illegally. H.P. has accused Karl Lamb of stealing trade secrets to start up his own flat-panel display company. Mr. Lamb’s lawsuit briefly re-raised the specter of pretexting, or the obtaining of personal information under false pretenses. Former H.P. executives, including ex-chairwoman Patricia C. Dunn, still faces charges that they authorized private investigators to pretext board members and reporters in the course of a leak investigation.

headline.main: Court Dismisses Claims of Additional Spying by H.P.
